Job description

Research Associate (Bioinformatician)

St George Hospital location, Sydney.

ORGANISATION

UNSW is currently implementing a ten year strategy to 2025 and our ambition for the next decade is nothing less than to establish UNSW as Australia’s global university. We aspire to this in the belief that a great university, which is a global leader in discovery, innovation, impact, education and thought leadership, can make an enormous difference to the lives of people in Australia and around the world.

Following extensive consultation in 2015, we identified three strategic priority areas. Firstly, a drive for academic excellence in research and education. Universities are often classified as ‘research intensive’ or ‘teaching intensive’. UNSW is proud to be an exemplar of both. We are amongst a limited group of universities worldwide capable of delivering research excellence alongside the highest quality education on a large scale. Secondly, a passion for social engagement, which improves lives through advancing equality, diversity, open debate and economic progress. Thirdly, a commitment to achieving global impact through sharing our capability in research and education in the highest quality partnerships with institutions in both developed and emerging societies. We regard the interplay of academic excellence, social engagement and global impact as the hallmarks of a great forward-looking 21st century university.

To achieve this ambition we are attracting the very best academic and professional staff to play leadership roles in our organisation.

UNSW Medicine is a national leader in learning, teaching and research, with close affiliations to a number of Australia’s finest hospitals, research institutes and health care organisations. With a strong presence at UNSW Kensington campus, the faculty have staff and students in teaching hospitals in Sydney as well as regional and rural areas of NSW including Albury/Wodonga, Wagga Wagga, Coffs Harbour and Port Macquarie.

The Department of Medicine is located at St George Hospital and is affiliated through the St George & Sutherland Clinical School, The University of New South Wales. The Professor of Medicine is Professor Emad El-Omar, a gastroenterologist with a longstanding research interest in infection and inflammation and the role of the gut microbiome in health and disease. He is the Director of the MRC and has established collaborations nationally and internationally with groups across Europe, North America and Asia.

The Research Associate (Bioinformatician) position is based at the recently established Microbiome Research Centre (MRC) at St George Hospital. The successful candidate will join a team of clinician scientists and basic scientists working at the forefront of research into the role of the gut microbiome in health and disease. The MRC has five research themes that include maternal and foetal health, cancer, critical care, mental health/neuroscience, and triple I (inflammation, infection and immunity). The successful candidate will have an opportunity to contribute to a large number of research projects within this theme and develop an outstanding career with opportunities for advanced training and development.

Responsibilities

Specific responsibilities for this role include:
  • Undertake research, including the conduct of experiments, on the role of the microbiome in heath and disease.
  • Undertake bioinformatic and statistical analysis and interpretation of data, and communication of the research output.
  • Engage in developing new research projects, consistent with departmental strengths and interests.
  • Produce and contribute to manuscripts, abstracts, posters and grant applications, as appropriate.
  • Identify funding opportunities and actively seek and apply for externally-funded fellowships and grants.
  • Establish and maintain collaborations with potential and current research partners.
  • Train and supervise research staff and students at both undergraduate and postgraduate level.
  • Promote the aims and objectives of the Department through activities such as presenting research findings at relevant meetings and making presentations at national and international scientific conferences.
  • Comply with UNSW research policies including the UNSW Intellectual Property Policy.
  • Effectively communicate and foster strong working relationships with technical, administrative and research staff.
  • Cooperate with all health and safety policies and procedures of the university and take all reasonable care to ensure that your actions or omissions do not impact on the health and safety of yourself or others.

SELECTION CRITERIA
  • A PhD degree in Systems Biology, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Biophysics or a related discipline.
  • Experience in statistical methods in the context of biological systems.
  • Proven experience with programming (e.g. R, Python, C++, Perl).
  • Experience with common pipelines for Metagenomics analysis: 16S- QIIME, Mothur, USEARCH.
  • Demonstrated experience in MEtaGenome ANalyze (MEGAN) pipeline, PICRUSt and RNA-Seq bioinformatics tools.
  • Demonstrated organisational skills with the ability to design and conduct complex studies independently as well as in multi-disciplinary team environment.
  • Capacity to develop an independent research portfolio with an established track record as evidenced by publications, conference presentations.
  • Demonstrated ability to supervise students at both undergraduate and postgraduate level.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills, with ability to present results and manuscripts for publication and present at conferences.
  • High level interpersonal skills with ability to coordinate work with collaborators from different Universities or Institutes.
  • Knowledge of health and safety responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant health and safety training.


How To Apply

You should systematically address the selection criteria listed within the position description, below, in your application. Please apply online - applications will not be accepted if sent directly to the contacts listed.

UNSW aims to ensure equality in recruitment, development, retention and promotion of staff, and that no-one is disadvantaged on the basis of their gender, cultural background, disability, sexual orientation or identity. We encourage everyone who meets the selection criteria to apply.

Job description

About Us

Western Health manages three acute public hospitals: Footscray, Sunshine and Williamstown Hospital. It also operates the Sunbury Day Hospital, Transition Care at Hazeldean and a range of community based services. We care for a culturally diverse population of more than 800,000 people. We have more than 6,700 employees who are driven by our values of 'Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence and Safety' (CARES).
Our continued growth will see the completion of a new purpose built, multi-storey Joan Kirner Women's and Children's Hospital.

About The Role

The ICT Database Administrator has the responsibility of delivering technical and functional support to applications and systems in Western Health (WH) within the Systems and Software Solutions Section of the WH Information Services Division (ICT). This role provides functional and technical support to a range of current and future systems within the WH ICT environment as it continue to find the balance between meeting operational demands and the need for delivering new projects and initiatives that have been identified as priorities across the business.
The ICT Database Administrator is responsible for the management of database services, under the supervision of the Team Lead: Systems. This involves directly managing services such as web hosting and development, development of in-house administrative applications. The incumbent is expected to provide expert advice on emerging technologies, including guidance as to their adoption. The ICT Database Administrator will develop and implement standards for database design and architecture, including access control, standards for queries and/or stored procedures, database naming conventions, and routine maintenance. The incumbent will manage the reporting environment for Western Health, and will develop and implement reports to support key business requirements. The ICT Database Administrator will be responsible for the engagement of specialist contract staff as required. This position reports to the Team Lead: Systems but is required to work largely unsupervised and is responsible for the management of complex projects.
The incumbent is expected to demonstrate a high degree of proficiency in a range of (Electronic Management Record) EMR related technologies, including design, configuration, integration (via HL7 framework), implementation, maintenance, upgrade, documentation, troubleshooting, and application delivery services. The ICT Database Administrator is expected to be an experienced Electronic Health (E-Health) technologist professional with a sound working understanding of database administration and data integration. The role will also work with the wider systems team to provide specialist database administration cover as required, including database support of WH Digital Medical Record (DMR) system.
As part of this role, there is a requirement to work through an on-call roster to provide after hour coverage as required. In addition to the key responsibilities specific to your role, you are required to deliver on the Key Organisational Accountabilities which are aligned with the Western Health strategic aims.

Culture

Western Health is an equal opportunity employer committed to attracting and retaining diversity in our workforce. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Job Description

Innovate & Power the world

As an Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) Analyst, you will be responsible to evaluate, select, and apply standard systems engineering techniques to conduct Logistics Support Analysis on proposed modifications to Royal Australian Navy Assets.

At Rolls-Royce, innovation is in our DNA. We pioneer integrated power and propulsion solutions across multiple markets. We embrace the power of data and technology and we aim to be Digital First in everything we do.

We’re the second largest global provider of defence aero-engine products and services globally with 16,000 engines in the service of 160 customers in 100 countries. Our engines power aircraft in every major sector, including: transport, combat, patrol, trainers, helicopters and unmanned aerial vehicles.

Rolls Royce Australia is in a joint venture partnership project to support Royal Australian Navy assets.

Join our team as an Integrated Logistic Support (ILS) Analyst and you will play a pivotal part in providing specialist advice through Logistics Support Analysis to the engineering team and drive Engineering changes through the life cycle.

Key Accountabilities
  • Specify and manage contracted Logistic Support Analysis to address engineering change; manage the engineering change of ILS artefacts through scope of work development, design reviews and deliverables acceptance.
  • Manage the incorporation of changes to ILS artefacts into the configuration and logistics baseline data sets.
  • Assist with undertaking analyses such as Failure Mode Effect and Criticality Analysis (FMECA), Reliability Centred Maintenance (RCM), Level of Repair (LORA), Sparing Analysis, and Life Cycle Cost Modelling associated with sustainment optimisation.
  • Assist with managing the performance of Organisational and External Planned Maintenance effectiveness through Failure Reporting and Corrective Action System (FRACAS) data analysis.
  • Assist with establishing an Life Cycle Cost (LCC), Reliability, Availability and Maintainability reporting environment to monitor and report on ILS program achievement utilising existing analysis data sets.
  • Assist with preparing reports on performance of the ILS program for management consideration and task performance including conduct of Root Cause Analysis.

Requirements
  • A minimum of 2 years relevant experience in an Integrated Logistic Support or Logistics Engineering related discipline (Essential).
  • Engineering experience ranging from 3 to 7 years in a Systems Engineering environment (Desirable).
  • Undergraduate degree in an Engineering discipline (Desirable).
  • A minimum of 2 years relevant experience within defence industry (Desirable).
  • Able to obtain engineering delegation of authority relevant to the position.
  • Able to obtain a Baseline security clearance or higher (Australian Citizen).
We offer excellent development prospects, along with a competitive salary and exceptional benefits. These include bonus and employee support assistance.

Administration Assistant - Sport

Company Name Wenona School Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 18 hours ago Number of views 52 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Position Title

Administration Assistant - Sport (Permanent, Full-Time)

Reports to

All positions report to the Principal

Line Manager - Director of Sport and Performance

Department

Sport

Location

North Sydney. Travel to various training and competition venues within the greater Sydney area as required.

Key Relationships

Internal: School Executive, Director of Sport and Performance, Head of Sport, Assistant Head of Sport, Sport Coordinators, Business Office staff, Students

External: Coaches, Parents, Sport Program venues, suppliers and providers

Organisation Context
The sporting program at Wenona is a vibrant and central part of school life, characterised by high levels of student engagement and participation across the Independent Girls’ Schools’ Sports Association (IGSSA), Independent Primary School Heads of Australia (IPSHA) and community based sporting organisations.

Wenona aims to foster a love of sport through a focus on developing an appreciation of team spirit, healthy and balanced lifestyles, and fair play in all sporting endeavours. It is these values that need to be central to all Sport staff and their approach to developing and nurturing skill development, a measured sense of competition and a courageous spirit of adventure in our girls.

Wenona values professional services staff who demonstrate a positive and proactive approach to their work and have a willingness to participate fully in the life of the School. We look for enthusiastic, dedicated and capable staff who demonstrate initiative, good humour, and professional behaviour and support the values and aims of the School as a global learning community.

Role Purpose And Overview

The purpose of the Administration Assistant - Sport is to provide high quality and efficient administration, organisation and operational support to the Sport Department. The role will be a critical part of the team responsible for the ongoing organisation, planning, preparation and operational management of all sport programs offered.

It is responsible for all aspects of registration for co-curricular sport programs across K-12 and coordinates the administrative functions related to coaching staff and external suppliers and providers.

There is an expectation that excellent, accurate and timely correspondence and customer service will be provided to a wide range of internal and external stakeholders.

The position also contributes to administrative support services at the School and the maintenance of a positive internal culture where service, integrity and humour are valued.

As with all support staff positions, this role is central to the operation of the School and supports student learning. All of our support and operations staff have a firm commitment to their own professional learning. They support the values of the School and work together with the academic staff to ensure the highest educational standards.
Key Responsibilities
Indications that this job is being done successfully would include:
  • Coordination of all aspects of student involvement in sport and co-curricular sport including clear and consistent communication to students, parents, coaching staff and maintain accurate database and portal pages ensuring all areas of the school are aware of student involvement.
  • Work with the Head of Sport and Assistant Head of Sport with regards to annual, term and weekly planning and resource management to ensure the efficient and accurate timetabling of sporting programs, ensure the sporting facilities are safe and the playing/venue facilities are available and prepared for sport, bookings, transportation and similar.
  • Develop, track and monitor student participation, attendance, injury management, rewards and recognition scheme, dress standards and ensure all documentation and records are accurate and current.
  • Maintain and update the School portal and work with the Communications Department to ensure social media channels are current and accurate information is available.
  • Develop a comprehensive and central summary of all sporting fixtures and relevant details and disseminate this on a weekly basis to all coaches, coordinators and members of the School Executive.
  • Ensure relevant student sporting records are maintained and an effective and efficient reporting and recording system for students Year K-12 is developed. This will include collating of all sporting records, accurate recording of results and achievements of teams/students and the promotion of the criteria for sporting awards.
  • Work in close consultation with the Personal Assistant to the Deputy Principal (Staff and Strategy) to coordinate all coach recruitment and on-boarding administration
  • Assist in the organisation of Sport Awards, Sport Tours and School Carnivals and independently coordinate smaller sporting events and activities, as required.
  • Promote participation and recognise opportunities for our students in sporting events
  • Record, monitor and track inventory of all School sporting equipment, coach and student sport uniforms.
  • Develop knowledge in a range of sports to enable and support the effective coordination of different sports each term and to foster the love of sports within our student body.
  • Providing administrative and operational assistance (including relief for Reception, Junior School Office, Student Office and similar) across the School to meet functional requirements and uphold the reputation of Wenona.
  • Undertake any other duties as directed by the Director of Sport and Performance and Head of Sport.

This position should develop a positive set of relationships with all School personnel and the wider community with deep knowledge of all School activities.

Qualifications And Experience
  • Qualifications in Sport/Event Management/Administration/Coaching or similar
  • Minimum of 2 years relevant experience in sport, event and/or project management/coordination; in an educational environment or similar is desirable
  • Minimum Level 1 Coaching qualifications; desirable
  • Valid driver’s licence and ability to travel independently between venues
  • Current NSW Working with Children Check
Knowledge and Skills
  • Good general sport knowledge and understanding of demands on athletes and coaches at a local community level
  • Demonstrated knowledge and skills of exceptional customer service and communication
  • Strong administration and IT skills demonstrated across MS Office, website, online portal and database systems
  • High level of accuracy, attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects and competing deadlines
  • Demonstrated skill in forming effective working relationships and working with a range of groups and individuals
  • Ability to maintain personal control and quality standards when faced with long hours of work and changing demands
  • Understanding of risk management as it relates to sport
Personal Style Attributes
  • An active interest in and commitment to the promotion of Girls’ sport
  • Personal drive and integrity with a willingness to take responsibility
  • Receptiveness to giving and receiving feedback and continuous learning
  • A team player with a willingness to put others before themselves
  • Clarity of thinking and ability to remain calm and perform under pressure
  • A sense of humour
General Conditions of the Role

Award

Independent Schools NSW (Support and Operational Staff) Multi Enterprise Agreement 2017

Classification

Clerical and Administrative Staff

Level 2

Hours of work

Permanent, full time, Monday to Friday, up to 38 hours per week.

The daily hours will be negotiated with the Director of Sport and Performance, depending on the needs of the students and the School.

The School will average the employee’s payment of wages and the rates will be paid in equal instalments throughout the year

Annual Leave

All annual leave should be taken during non-term time.

Professional Learning

You will be expected to attend and contribute to all staff professional development days and requirements as outlined in the School’s calendar

Wenona is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion, sexual orientation or age.
